page.title: 07COALBOARD RESEARCH DEPOT
page.content: There are{500 people who work}at the Coal Board. This Coal Board is 37 years old. One of the buildings has been there since before the Second World War. 446 men and 54 women work there. It does not matter if the site gives off much{pollution}because it is only dust. They have special machines to collect the dust. Most of the workers live by Tewkesbury and Cheltenham. The{discoveries}over the years are coke, gas, petrol and diesel, nylon and aspirin. Also the discovery that the glass observation panel in the front of coal stoves is better made from rods of glass than a sheet of material then the panel does not get smoked or blackened. When the Miners' Strike was on, they received coal from the Midland, Nottingham and Sheffield coal fields.
